title: pagination bug when removing an item
body: reported by a pro user if for exemple we have a table with 10 items per page and we have 11 items in it if we go to the second page and then remove that last item the table display an empty list (without any empty message from the template and the paginator is showing that we are on page 1 but if we click on the paginator's left arrow, then the table is displayed correctly when there is no more items on the current page the paginator should go to the previous page and display the items correctly

title: helm podantiaffinity templating error
body:
"**describe the bug**

helm charts fail to generate proper podantiaffinity.

in my `values.yaml` file i define the following:

```
mixer:

  podantiaffinitytermlabelselector:
    - key: istio
      operator: in
      values: mixer
      topologykey: kubernetes.io/hostname
```
and after running `helm template` i noticed it generates the following output:

```
        podantiaffinity:
          preferredduringschedulingignoredduringexecution:
          - podaffinityterm:
              labelselector:
                matchexpressions:
                - key: istio
                  operator: in
              topologykey: kubernetes.io/hostname
            weight: 100
```

https://github.com/istio/istio/blob/release-1.1/install/kubernetes/helm/istio/templates/_affinity.tpl#l83

if i change `.value` in `.values` i get the expected output.

thanks!

**expected behavior**

```
        podantiaffinity:
          preferredduringschedulingignoredduringexecution:
          - podaffinityterm:
              labelselector:
                matchexpressions:
                - key: istio
                  operator: in
                  values:
                  - mixer
              topologykey: kubernetes.io/hostname
            weight: 100
```

**version**
branch: release-1.1

**installation**
helm
"

title: configurable window of completion
body: "from #146, not fixed: the window for completion of a given questionnaire should be configurable in the `protocol.json`, currently it is hardcoded. radar-base/radar-armt-protocols#7.\r\n\r\nthis is useful for one-time or long-time questionnaires like demographics, where the completion window can be the entire study or a few weeks and the questionnaire should remain until completed. it is also for customising the timeout for esm-style tests without hard-coding the timeouts in the app."

title: add search counts to baseline ping
body:
"follow up on https://github.com/mozilla-mobile/fenix/issues/959#issuecomment-475394264

bbinto update on april 1, 2019

it was identified that some basic / core pings are not included "for free" in the new glean sdk baseline ping. this ticket is about including the additional pings product wants to track

#### description & product manager 
- as a product owner, i want to know how many searches have been conducted in fenix

#### hypothesis
- we believe that our app is most useful when users can and increase their searches

#### what questions will you answer with this data?
- how many searchers per user/day etc. have been triggered.

#### why does mozilla need to answer these questions? are there benefits for users? do we need this information to address product or business requirements?
- report on search counts as one of our main kpis

#### what probes (suggested, if applicable)
- search count, see row 27 in https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1p2_agee9otjm3x71d0gbhnhdhzxel02xehukn1no23e/edit#gid=0

### dependencies (added by pm and eng)
- core ping / baseline ping, see comment here

### acceptance criteria (added by pm)
- baseline pings can be queried via re:dash
- we are sending telemetry events for the actions listed in the requirements
- we have documented the telemetry
- we have asked a data steward to [review](https://github.com/mozilla/data-review/blob/master/request.md) the telemetry
- not an ac: data science to create dashboard or further graphs (this will be a separate issue, this issue is only about hooking up the events described and that they can be queried in re-dash)
"

title: show zone configuration for table table name partition partition name doesnt work
body:
"**describe the problem**

i partitioned a table, created replication zones for the partition, viewed one of the replication zones with the `show zone configuration for partition <partition_name> of table <table_name>` syntax (this worked), and then tried to do the same thing with the `show zone configuration for table <table_name> partition <partition_name>` syntax (didn't work).

**cockroach version**

```
~$ cockroach version
build tag:    v2.2.0-alpha.20190211-100-g10f8010fa5-dirty
build time:   2019/02/13 03:42:25
distribution: ccl
platform:     darwin amd64 (x86_64-apple-darwin17.7.0)
go version:   go1.11
c compiler:   4.2.1 compatible apple llvm 10.0.0 (clang-1000.10.44.4)
build sha-1:  10f8010fa5778e740c057905e2d7664b5fd5d647
build type:   development
```

**to reproduce**

1. start up a local cluster.

2. open the sql shell.

3. set an enterprise license.

4. create a database:

```
create database roachlearn;
```

5. create a table with partitions:

```
create table roachlearn.students (
    id int default unique_rowid(),
    name string,
    email string,
    country string,
    expected_graduation_date date,   
    primary key (country, id))
    partition by list (country) (
      partition north_america values in ('ca','us'),
      partition europe values in ('de', 'ch'),
      partition australia values in ('au','nz'),
      partition default values in (default)
    );
```

6. create replication zones for partitions:

```
alter partition north_america of table roachlearn.students     configure zone using constraints='[+region=us]';

alter partition europe of table roachlearn.students     configure zone using constraints='[+region=de]';
alter partition australia of table roachlearn.students     configure zone using constraints='[+region=aus]';
```

7. view the replication zone for one of the partitions:

```
show zone configuration for partition north_america of table roachlearn.students;
              zone_name             |                                           config_sql
+-----------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
  roachlearn.students.north_america | alter partition north_america of index roachlearn.public.students@primary configure zone using
                                    |     range_min_bytes = 16777216,
                                    |     range_max_bytes = 67108864,
                                    |     gc.ttlseconds = 90000,
                                    |     num_replicas = 3,
                                    |     constraints = '[+region=us]',
                                    |     lease_preferences = '[]'
(1 row)
```

8. try to use an alternative syntax to view the replication zone:

```
show zone configuration for table roachlearn.students partition north_america;
  zone_name |                config_sql
+-----------+------------------------------------------+
  .default  | alter range default configure zone using
            |     range_min_bytes = 16777216,
            |     range_max_bytes = 67108864,
            |     gc.ttlseconds = 90000,
            |     num_replicas = 3,
            |     constraints = '[]',
            |     lease_preferences = '[]'
(1 row)
```
"

title: improvements to default layout
body:
" the default layout needs to be changed in the following way:
- [x] stats widget removed from layout, as it slows down animations
- [x] log widget removed from layout, as it's not needed by default
- [x] default layout for screens with a certain cutoff height (720px?) should group animator and region list in a single tab
- [x] spectral and histogram widgets should have their region and stokes selectors shown in a row above the graph, rather than in the settings panel"

title: backtest report enhancement add profitability for human readability
body:
"backtest rather accurately reports avg % and number of trades. 
this somewhat obfuscates from how profitable the backtest has been. 

as example:  "109 trades : avg prf 5.334% "
can also be written as *$581% profitable  - which may be of interest and benefit to users. 

* assuming no parallel trades needed. 




## step 1: have you search for this issue before posting it?

if you have discovered a bug in the bot, please [search our issue tracker](https://github.com/freqtrade/freqtrade/issues?q=is%3aissue). 
if it hasn't been reported, please create a new issue.

title: cgmes reactive capability point with duplicate points
body:
"* **do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
bug


* **what is the current behavior?**
first we need to check if it is supported in cgmes spec. here is the exception we get when there is 2 differents reactive ranges for the same active power value:
```java
com.powsybl.iidm.network.impl.validationexception: generator 'xxx': a point already exists for active power 18.8 with a different reactive power range: [-11.28, 30.9] != [-4.7, 4.7]
```

* **if the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem**
simply create a test case with a generator and a reactive capability with 2 points with a different reactive range.


* **what is the expected behavior?**
just keep first????


* **what is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?**
there is real data with such reactive capability curve.


* **please tell us about your environment:**
  - powsybl version: 2.5.0-snapshot
  - os version: ...

* **other information** (e.g. detailed explanation, stacktraces, related issues, suggestions how to fix, links for us to have context, eg. stackoverflow, spectrum, etc)

(if a question doesn't apply, you can delete it)
"
